フォームをダウンロード 婚姻届 (Marriage Registration)

婚姻届について

婚姻届は、法的な結婚（法律婚）を成立させるために市区町村役場に提出する最も重要な届出です。日本では、結婚式を挙げただけでは法的な夫婦とは認められず、この届出が受理された日が「入籍日（婚姻成立日）」となります。

重要な注意

プレビュー、ダウンロード、またはこのドキュメントへの記入ボタンはこのページの下部にあります。

記入の重要ポイント

  • 証人： 成人（18歳以上）2名の署名と捺印が必要です。通常、両親や仲人がなることが多いですが、友人でも構いません。
  • 本籍地： 現在の戸籍に記載されている正確な本籍地を記入する必要があります。新しい本籍地もこの届出で決定します。
  • 印鑑： 認印で構いませんが、夫婦で別々の印鑑を使用する必要があります（旧姓の印鑑を使用します）。

届出は365日24時間いつでも可能ですが、夜間や休日は宿直窓口での預かりとなり、翌開庁日に審査されます。不備がなければ提出日に遡って受理されます。

ドキュメントプレビュー 記入/ダウンロード

関連サービス

フォームをダウンロード 社用車使用誓約書 (Company Car)

The Shayosha Shiyo Seiyakusho regulates the use of company-owned vehicles. This is distinct from commuting; it applies to sales staff or delivery drivers who use company assets to perform their work. It establishes that the vehicle is a tool for business, not a personal perk.

Rules of Use
The pledge usually forbids "private use" (e.g., driving the car home or for weekend shopping) unless explicitly authorized. It mandates daily inspections (checking tires, oil, lights) which are required under Japanese road safety laws for fleet operators. It also requires the employee to keep the vehicle clean and presentable as it represents the company image.

Accident Protocol
A vital section dictates the protocol for accidents. The employee pledges to report even minor scratches immediately. Failure to report an accident (hit-and-run or hiding damage) is often grounds for immediate disciplinary dismissal.

フォームをダウンロード 自動二輪車通勤誓約書 (Motorcycle)

The Jido Nirinsha Tsukin Seiyakusho covers commuting by motorcycle or scooter. Due to the higher risk of fatality and serious injury associated with motorcycles compared to cars or trains, many Japanese companies historically banned motorcycle commuting entirely (the "Three No Movement"). However, companies that do permit it require strict pledges.

Risk Management
This document is designed to waive company liability. It strictly mandates the wearing of helmets and proper protective gear. It requires proof of insurance (CALI/Jibaiseki and voluntary insurance). It often includes a clause that if the employee is injured due to reckless driving, they may not be entitled to the company's private solatium (sympathy money) payments, distinct from government worker's comp.

Registration
The employee must register the specific license plate number to prevent the use of illegal modifications or unregistered vehicles on company property.

フォームをダウンロード 自転車通勤誓約書 (Bicycle)

The Jitensha Tsukin Seiyakusho regulates bicycle commuting. While seen as eco-friendly, bicycles are frequently involved in accidents in Japan. With local governments increasingly mandating bicycle liability insurance, companies are following suit by requiring employees to sign this pledge.

Safety and Manners
The document focuses on adherence to traffic laws (e.g., no riding under the influence, no smartphone use while riding, no umbrella use while riding). It emphasizes that the bicycle is a "light vehicle" under Japanese law and must be operated responsibly.

Insurance
A critical component of this pledge is the confirmation that the employee has bicycle liability insurance. In the event the employee hits a pedestrian while commuting, damages can be astronomical (millions of yen). This pledge ensures the employee is personally insured so the company does not become the target of litigation.

フォームをダウンロード マイカー通勤誓約書 (My Car)

The My Car Tsukin Seiyakusho is required when an employee requests permission to commute to work using their private vehicle. In urban Japan (Tokyo/Osaka), car commuting is rare, but in rural industrial areas, it is common. Companies need to strictly regulate this to minimize liability.

Key Requirements
This pledge verifies that the employee holds a valid driver's license and, most importantly, has enrolled in voluntary automobile insurance (Nini Hoken) with sufficient coverage (often "unlimited" bodily injury coverage). Compulsory insurance (Jibaiseki) is rarely considered enough by employers.

Liability Clause
The document clarifies that the company is not responsible for accidents caused by the employee's private car, even during the commute. It shifts the burden of handling accidents to the employee. It also often includes a promise not to drive under the influence of alcohol, which carries severe social and legal penalties in Japan.
